pageContext.claim: “Drug prices declined in 2018, the first time in nearly half a century. During the first 19 months of my Administration, Americans saved $26 Billion on prescription drugs. Our policies to get cheaper generic drugs to market are working!”
pageContext.analysis: The consumer price index for prescription drugs fell by 0.6 percent for the 12 months ending Dec. 2018, the first time in 46 years. But the second part of the statement is more problematic. Trump appears to take credit in $26 billion in savings in prescription drugs. That’s a figure just for generic drugs – and it includes generics that would have come onto the market no matter who was president. The Trump administration has pushed for faster generic approvals, but it’s unknown what percentage of these savings are the result of the administration’s policies.
